intro: Codonanthe serrulata, commonly known as the serrated codonanthe, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant, white or pink flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically opposite and have serrated edges, giving it its common name. Codonanthe serrulata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
